meanings.definition: Having a tendency to donate electrons in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: The electropositive atom easily gives away its electrons.
meanings.sent2: In chemistry, an electropositive element is one that likes to donate electrons.
meanings.sent3: The electropositive molecule was so generous, it donated electrons to everyone in the reaction.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was as electropositive as a metal eager to lose electrons.
meanings.sent5: The electropositive behavior of the compound made it stand out in the experiment.

meanings.definition: A metal that readily loses electrons in a chemical reaction.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use electropositive metals in various experiments.
meanings.sent2: An electropositive metal quickly loses electrons when reacting.
meanings.sent3: The electropositive metal was in a hurry to shed its electrons, like a runner at the starting line.
meanings.sent4: The electropositive nature of the metal shone brightly in the lab.
meanings.sent5: The electropositive properties of the metal made it a valuable component in the study.
